snippet: In the eyes of many along the Elbe and the Danube, it is not too early to raise questions about why the region was hit again so soon after record flooding in 2002.
abstract: Meissen Journal; German authorities say it is too early to assess damage from flooding along Elbe and Danube rivers, which has fallen just short of 2002's record levels, but group Institute for Economic Research estimates that costs could run as high as $7.9 billion in Germany alone; many residents, who lost homes in 2002, question why area was hit again so soon.
lead_paragraph: In the eyes of many along the Elbe and the Danube, it is not too early to raise questions about why the region was hit again so soon after record flooding in 2002.

headline.seo: In Flooded Areas of Europe, Familiar Feelings and New Questions
headline.main: In Flooded Europe, Familiar Feelings and New Questions
headline.print_headline: In Flooded Europe, Familiar Feelings And New Questions
